briefSummary: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality, seen through the eyes of a young girl in the 1930s South.
A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian regime, exploring the consequences of mass surveillance, censorship, and mind control.
A tragic love story set in the Roaring Twenties, exploring themes of wealth, social class, and the American Dream.
The story of Captain Ahab's obsessive quest to kill Moby Dick, a massive white whale, symbolizing humanity's struggle against nature.
A romantic novel about the manners and matrimonial machinations among the British middle class in the early 19th century.
A young man's journey through life, dealing with alienation, rebellion, and the loss of innocence as he confronts adult society.
An epic novel covering the Napoleonic Wars, with intricate character studies and philosophical reflections on the nature of war and peace.
A dystopian novel exploring the consequences of a technologically advanced society where human emotions are controlled, and individuality is suppressed.
A young hobbit embarks on an adventure with dwarves to reclaim treasure from a dragon, encountering goblins, elves, and trolls along the way.
A young man remains eternally youthful while his portrait ages, serving as a symbol of his moral decay and self-destructive lifestyle.
